intro: Eriogonum baileyi var. praebens, commonly known as the Bailey's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiky inflorescence composed of small, usually white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces achenes as its fruit type. This species is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks in its native range.
